title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti until all done.
Fry pancetta until crisp.
Mix eggs and cheese together.
Combine spaghetti, pancetta, and egg mixture.
Serve with black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and tikka masala paste.
Grill chicken until cooked through.
Simmer tomato puree and spices.
Add chicken and cream to sauce.
Serve with rice or naan.

title: Avocado Toast
summary: Toasted bread topped with smashed avocado, lemon juice, and chili flakes.
instructions: Toast the bread: Place the bread in a toaster or pan and toast to your preferred level of crispiness.
Prepare the avocado: Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Squeeze the lemon or lime juice over it to add brightness and prevent browning.
Mash and season: Using a fork, mash the avocado to your desired consistency—some prefer a smoother texture, while others like it chunky. Mix in a pinch of salt and pepper.
Assemble and serve: Spread the seasoned avocado mash evenly over the toast. Drizzle with a touch of extra-virgin olive oil and add a final sprinkle of flaky sea salt and pepper.

title: Pancakes with Berries
summary: Fluffy pancakes stacked with fresh berries and maple syrup.
ingredients: ½ cup fresh or frozen blueberries, thawed
instructions: Sift flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt together in a large bowl.
Combine milk and egg in a small bowl.
Stir egg mixture into flour mixture until just combined.
Stir in melted butter, then fold in blueberries.
For best results, set the batter aside for 1 hour.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the hot griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake
Cook until bubbles appear on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot.
